In Bangladesh, police have used excessive force against protesters, resulting in deaths and injuries. In Iran, women have been subject to violence and arrests for not complying with mandatory headscarf laws. In Iraq, police were used by Saddam Hussein to arrest opponents, and in India, police have used excessive force during protests and independence struggles. In Indonesia, Islamic extremists have been targeted by police, and there have been cases of police corruption.
